meanings.definition: The middle of a calendar year.
meanings.sent1: My birthday falls in the midyear, right in the middle of the year.
meanings.sent2: Many people set new goals at the midyear point, halfway through the year.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how we always seem to have a midyear crisis when we realize the year is halfway over.
meanings.sent4: The midyear is like a hump in the year, where we can look back at the past months and plan for the rest.
meanings.sent5: The midyear is a pivotal time to reflect on our progress and make adjustments for the future.

meanings.definition: The middle of an academic year.
meanings.sent1: Students often feel a sense of accomplishment when they reach the midyear of their studies.
meanings.sent2: Teachers use the midyear break to recharge and prepare for the second half of the academic year.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how some students think the midyear is the end of the school year, only to realize there's more to come.
meanings.sent4: The midyear is like a bridge between the beginning and end of the academic journey, a time to assess and improve.
meanings.sent5: Reaching the midyear of the academic year is a milestone worth celebrating for both students and educators.
